result.execSummary:
The defendant David B Burke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.  1 day credit if
probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.  May terminate after 9 months if deemed appropriate by Agent.

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision

Defendant David B Burke in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the correspondence filed by the Defendant.  The Defendant advises the Court he has been revoked and inquires as to if new charges will be filed by the State.  The Court takes no action.
Review hearing on September 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
From Atty McMahon dated 9/16/16 with attached letter provided to defendants serving revocation.

From defendant received 9/12/16 inquiring when he will come back to court.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 9/13/16; Contact the PDs office, given that Mr. Fragoso is no longer there, and inquire whether someone has been assigned to Mr. Burke.
Responded 9/14/16; defendant has not reapplied nor evaluated for representation.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 9/14/16; Set for a prompt hearing.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David B Burke in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding sentencing.  Eric W. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME (CREDIT - 1 day credit, if revoked)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1  YEAR   * may terminate after 9 months if deemed appropriate by agent*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs / drug paraphernalia
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;


COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-16-2016 02:00 pm
From Atty Fragoso dated 1/24/16 requesting adjournment of 2/1/16 due to defendant's current medical condition.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-01-2016 09:30 am
Medical letter filed.

Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court.   Defendant David B Burke did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso advises the Court for the missed appearance due to medical reasons.  The Court wavies the Defendant's appearance.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 12-14-2015 09:00 am

Defendant David B Burke in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso is waint  for discovery but does have an offer.   Attorney Fraogos to advise the Court how the case will to go plea and sentencing or set for a trial. Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 11-06-2015 10:00 am
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant David B Burke in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
